meanings.definition: A Russian peasant or agricultural laborer.
meanings.sent1: The muzhiks worked hard in the fields all day.
meanings.sent2: The village was full of muzhiks tending to their crops.
meanings.sent3: The muzhiks had a dance party after a successful harvest.
meanings.sent4: The muzhiks were the backbone of the rural community.
meanings.sent5: The muzhiks sang traditional songs while plowing the land.

meanings.sent1: Many muzhiks gathered in the market to sell their produce.
meanings.sent2: The muzhiks shared stories around the campfire at night.
meanings.sent3: The group of muzhiks decided to start a small business together.
meanings.sent4: The fields were alive with the sounds of muzhiks singing.
meanings.sent5: The muzhiks celebrated the end of the season with a feast.
